column4: wow I'm really having a terrible time here setting up this network, my girlfriend and I have been trying this for about 4 1/2 hours.. no exaggeration
brief summary?

Ok, I set up Samba on my Ubuntu machine, we have an XP machine which has been set up, we can see the Ubuntu machine from My Network Connections, but we can't access the Ubuntu machine, it doesn't even prompt for a passowrd
pastebin your smb.conf
command not found
command?
i typed "smb.conf" and that's what I got
command not found again
didn't put gedit, sorry ahha
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/56927/plain/
dumb question i know, but do you have a firewall running?
got booted again.. letting you know i'm still here, incase you responded
just asking if you have a firewall on the ubuntu box
yes, firestarter
i disabled it, you think we should restart both computers?
we had firewalls on both computers disabled, nothing changed
maybe restart the workstation service on the xp box
are you behind a router?
yes a wireless router
I've read that, we just got the router today, I've been using Ubuntu for a month or so
definitely disable the firewalls at least to test
